Crimes.Legal_Issue: Personalized vs. generalized risk under IRPA
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, paragraph 97(1)(b)(ii)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Federal Court review of Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate personalized risk
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Applicant's claims assessed as not establishing individualized targeting
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Protection only for personalized risks not shared by a significant group
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard applied to Board's findings
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Risk due to extortion demands in El Salvador
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Claim failed on merits due to generalized nature of risk
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Immigration and Refugee Board, upheld by Federal Court
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Extortion demands targeting perceived wealthy individuals or business owners
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Seeking protection based on fear of crime in El Salvador
Crimes.Legal_Rule_Source: Statutory: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Stay of removal and protected person status
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board; Federal Court
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 97(1)(b)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Risk of victimization due to perceived wealth
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No error found in Board’s assessment
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (Federal Court), subject to international context (El Salvador)

Crimes.Sub_Crime_Type: Threats and physical assault related to extortion
Crimes.Perpetrator_Type: Criminal actors (e.g., gangs) exploiting economic vulnerability
Crimes.Victim_Status: Individual targeted due to perceived wealth or business ownership
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: History of violence associated with extortion networks
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: No evidence of specific personal vendetta beyond financial motive
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Pattern of extortion-related assaults in country context
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: High level of violent crime in El Salvador affecting business owners
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient to establish general risk but not individual targeting
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Credible but insufficient to prove personalized risk
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Plausible claims but lack specificity to show unique danger
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Generalized risk based on socioeconomic profile
Crimes.Targeted_Victimization: No evidence of individualized selection beyond category-based targeting
Crimes.Targeted_Individual_Status: Private citizen exposed to common criminal threat
Crimes.Geographic_Context: Urban areas in El Salvador with high extortion rates
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (Federal Court), involving foreign country conditions (El Salvador)
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canadian immigration law – refugee and protection provisions
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 97(1)(b)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Standard of review, burden and credibility
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Appeal from Immigration and Refugee Board decision
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada

Crimes.Victim_Status: Business owner or person perceived as wealthy
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Use of violence or credible threat of violence
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Motivation purely financial, not ideological or identity-based
Crimes.Prior_Criminality: Widespread pattern of extortion in El Salvador
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: Severe and systemic issue affecting broad population segment
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Establishes general prevalence but not individualized risk
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Generally credible but lacks distinguishing details
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Consistent with known patterns but does not show uniqueness
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Generalized risk due to socioeconomic status
Crimes.Targeted_Individual_Status: Civilian subject to common criminal enterprise
Crimes.Geographic_Context: High-crime urban zones in El Salvador
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Canada (Federal Court), concerning conditions in El Salvador
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 97(1)(b)(ii)
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Paragraph 97(1)(b)(ii) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Not applicable – protection claim, not criminal prosecution
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Assessment of personal vs. general risk
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Challenge to Immigration and Refugee Board determination
